comments.body:
I rewrote this test so I wouldn't have to also cherry pick https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/52109 (which is pretty intertwined with the actual new test in #53559).

Is that the right approach? Should I just redo this and cherry pick  https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/52109 as well?
IMO the risk of going ahead without the unit test is acceptable in this specific case, but being the PR writer it is better to have a second opinion if possible...
I think I covered this new check reasonably with the test I added. I just want to make sure I'm not making future cherry picks even harder by diverging more than necessary.

shouldn't we add more test cases here, like
 - if already exists, it should be updated, not error
 - if an error is returned on creation; the func should error out
 - if an error is returned when updating (given the cm already exists), the func should error
?
Shoudn't we also check that the contents here matches a specific byte array or something to make sure the marshal and conversion works properly?
